page.title: 07Local housing types.
page.content: Groups of older semi-detached houses built in the nineteen thirties by the local council each have their own front and back garden. More recent housing development in the area includes twenty five detached bungalows at Rushyford (half a mile south of Chilton) and a residential estate of mixed detached houses, semi- detached houses and bungalows completed within the last year and sited in the N.E. corner of Chilton. The hamlet of Bradbury, two miles east of Chilton, has a mixture of properties ranging from renovated old farm cottages to more contemporary buildings set in rural surroundings. The largest single house in the area is Chilton Hall, which having once served among other things as a tramps' hostel, is now, once again, an imposing dwelling house.
